p: To start with, Tonelli et al. prepared a set of benzimidazole derivatives as part of their continuous work in the chemistry and biological properties of benzimidazoles. In this study, a variety of moieties have been substituted at position-1 and 2 of benzimidazole; unsubstituted, basic, non-basic, aromatic, non-aromatic substitutions were synthetically introduced [ 37]. In order to highlight the importance of the presence of fluorine moiety, the derivative of benzimidazole with trifluoromethyl at position-2, compound 27 exhibited higher potency against CVB-5, RSV and YFV, with EC 50 of 11, 22, and 33 μM respectively compared to its analogue 28 having a 2-methyl moiety with EC 50 of 47, >100, and 33 μM respectively. The importance of trifluoromethyl has been proven by the narrower spectrum of activity and lower potency compared to the 2-methyl benzimidazole analogue 28.
